channel.title: Mute command
channel.description:
hey, i need a mute command
But i need a working everyone give me a mute command who dont work. so please post if you have and post a working one!

item.title: Mute command
item.dc:creator: @xray_veeo xray veeo
item.description:
@xray_veeo wrote:

Use a boolean. i prefer arrays though.

muted = false

simple like that and in a mute command, put.

if (muted = true) {
sendMessage("your muted blah blah blah");

so the code would be somewhat like this:

            if (command.startsWith("mute") && playerRights > 0) {
                try {
                    String otherPName = command.substring(5);
                    int otherPIndex = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(otherPName);

                    if (otherPIndex != -1) {
                        client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[otherPIndex];

                        p.muted = true;
			writeLog(p.playerName, "mutes");
			sendMessage("You have muted "+p.playerName+"!");
                    } else { 
                       sendMessage("The name doesnt exist."); 
                    }
                } catch (Exception e) { 
                    sendMessage("Try entering a name you want to mute..");
                }
            }

and the boolean is used here:

p.muted = true;

Read full topic

item.title: Mute command
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

[quote=“x blitz x, post:11, topic:257425”][quote author=the soul link=topic=339855.msg2634313#msg2634313 date=1232399521]

Yes, but when helping someone, you would obviously state the best method of doing something, otherwise you’ll tell them a shit method, then they’ll carry on using that, then tell someone else. Chain reaction you see.

Then they should learn the basics of Java before trying to program in it.
The problem is most of the members don’t know what the fuck data types are, so I’m assuming he doesn’t either.
[/quote][/quote]

That’s exactly my point, and most of the users don’t.

Read full topic

item.title: Mute command
item.dc:creator: @x_blitz_x x blitz x
item.description:
@x_blitz_x wrote:

[quote=“ringer24, post:8, topic:257425”]Personally i think using:

if (muted == 1) //perm
if (muted == 2) // 12 hour
if (muted == 3) // 6 hour
if (muted == 4) // 3 hour

would be pretty efficient.[/quote]

switch(muted) { case 1: break; case 2: break; case 3: break; case 4: break; }

item.title: Mute command
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

[quote=“ringer24, post:5, topic:257425”][quote author=the soul link=topic=339855.msg2634282#msg2634282 date=1232397422]

What happened to booleans? There is that data type. Moparscape and there integers, seriously.

You can use an integer to specify if the user may talk, then you would make if (muted == 1) {[/quote]

I wasn’t stating that you absolutely have to, you can use arrays for god sakes.

booleans are better for muting to be honest. Arrays would be better for temporary bans or something like that.[/quote]

I’m just saying that it is too another data type.

Read full topic
